basics.name: Alex Kim
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Data scientist passionate about turning messy data into actionable insights. Experienced in building machine learning models, natural language processing pipelines, and scalable cloud-based solutions. Always curious, always learning.

work.name: DataNest Labs
work.summary: Leading data science projects in predictive modeling and NLP, deploying models into production on AWS.
highlights: Developed a customer churn prediction model with 85% accuracy, reducing client attrition by 20%
Built an NLP pipeline to automatically categorize support tickets, improving triage efficiency by 30%
Mentored 3 junior data scientists on deep learning and MLOps best practices

volunteer.summary: Worked on projects applying data science for social good.
highlights: Built dashboards to help a non-profit optimize donation campaigns

awards.title: Best Data Science Project
awards.summary: Awarded for a capstone project predicting wildfire risks using satellite data.

publications.name: Understanding Bias in Machine Learning Models
publications.summary: Explores strategies for detecting and mitigating bias in ML systems.

references.name: Jamie Chen
references.reference: Alex is an outstanding data scientist with an amazing ability to balance technical depth and real-world application.

projects.name: Disaster Response Classifier
projects.description: A machine learning system to classify disaster-related tweets for emergency response.
highlights: Deployed model as a REST API using Flask and AWS Elastic Beanstalk
